comments.body: is this correct? it's using a different format from the other two jobs.

You mean the `PROJECT` name? If so, it's intended. GCE has a limit of 30 chars on project names, and `kubekins-gke-e2e-trusty-staging` is over the limit so I decided to trim it. You are right it's not analogical to others, but I don't think it matters, and this is the project that I have credentials, quotas and other acls set up.
ok, just wanted to make sure that it was intentional.
minor suggestion: maybe in the outer if block ("if kubernetes-upgrade") set `E2E_UP="false"` and `E2E_DOWN="false"` - then you only need to override for step1 and step7.
I think that's DRY-er but less clear.  I'd rather have clarity.  (Also when this stuff gets pulled into YAMLs, it'll have to get factored back in.)

comments.body: can you not use ci/latest-1.1.txt at least?

Isn't ci/latest-1.1.txt a moving target? We want to pin to a version so that when test failures happen, we know it's the image, not k8s, that's at fault. Both of these two jobs are used as CI to qualify our image builds.
should this be -beta or something like that? I'm not seeing how this job is different from the non-beta version

`trusty-beta` is not a supported `KUBE_OS_DISTRIBUTION`. `kubernetes-e2e-gce-trusty-release-beta` and `kubernetes-e2e-gce-trusty-release` are testing different versions of the same image, which are determined by `JOB_NAME`, if you noticed that it's encoded in `get_latest_trusty_image`.

I'll refactor that function to make it clearer.
This network is manually created with custom settings. Should add a comment here stating how to recreate it (ideally with gcloud command to use) if it gets deleted accidentally.
Done.

Can you put the gcloud command flags or mention what checkbox(s) to tick on ui? If a month from now it gets deleted, good chance the person fixing the test won't know what options to recreate it with.
It's straightforward https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/subnetworks#networks_and_subnetworks : in the CLI or UI, just check the "auto" mode.  No further options.
Added the gcloud line.

comments.body: do you need alpha and beta in addition to preview?

The code we're replacing might update either:
https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/blob/master/cluster/gke/util.sh#L101

It seemed safe to update all given we're skipping that code. Is there any reason not to?

I'm confused. You don't need any of these. `update` updates everything - I've watched it. This code should be redundant - the code in `util.sh` has been redundant for a long time, and I've been meaning to clean it up.

The `update alpha -q` / etc. is only useful for guaranteeing the component is installed, which we don't need here.

cc @jlowdermilk
How did the bug I linked in the PR description happen?

hm, maybe some sort of weird race with another `gcloud update` call or something?

Running `gcloud components list` from the Jenkins master VM shows that the preview, alpha, and beta components are all installed and up-to-date.
Yes, this state can change. The issue is that the preview component wasn't installed.

This PR is fine. Discussed offline with @jlowdermilk - it's a common location for a freshly installed gcloud, which is getting installed often enough that we end up reinstalling components here.

My thinking is actually correct for the normal gcloud on normal runs, though.
Thank you for digging in!

    GITHASH=$(gsutil cat gs://kubernetes-release/ci/latest.txt)

comments.body: Why is "match-server-version=false" needed here?
The `kubernetes-e2e-gke` job is version skewed, and `hack/e2e.go` adds `--match-server-version` before calling `kubectl`, so this is basically counteracting it.
so this is testing a new client on an old cluster?

That's one of the jobs, and it also has to explicitly change E2E_OPT. I'm
just logging the client/server versions here, so really just want something
that won't error out regardless.

On Mon, Jan 12, 2015, 14:54 Daniel Smith notifications@github.com wrote:

> In hack/jenkins/e2e.sh
> https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/pull/3415#discussion-diff-22830171
> :
> 
> > +
> > +# sudo gcloud components update -q
> > +
> > +GITHASH=$(gsutil cat gs://kubernetes-release/ci/latest.txt)
> > +gsutil -m cp gs://kubernetes-release/ci/${GITHASH}/kubernetes.tar.gz gs://kubernetes-release/ci/${GITHASH}/kubernetes-test.tar.gz .
> > +md5sum kubernetes*.tar.gz
> > +tar -xzf kubernetes.tar.gz
> > +tar -xzf kubernetes-test.tar.gz
> > +cd kubernetes
> > +
> > +# This variable is only relevant on GKE-CI
> > +export CLUSTER_API_VERSION=$(echo ${GITHASH} | cut -c 2-)
> > +
> > +go run ./hack/e2e.go ${E2E_OPT} -v -down
> > +go run ./hack/e2e.go ${E2E_OPT} -v -up
> > +go run ./hack/e2e.go -v -ctl="version --match-server-version=false"
> 
> so this is testing a new client on an old cluster?
> 
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/pull/3415/files#r22830171
> .

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +77,81 @@go run ./hack/e2e.go ${E2E_OPT} -v -down
go run ./hack/e2e.go ${E2E_OPT} -v -up
go run ./hack/e2e.go -v -ctl="version --match-server-version=false"
go run ./hack/e2e.go ${E2E_OPT} --test -tap | tee ../e2e.${JOB_NAME}.${BUILD_NUMBER}.${GITHASH}.tap
go run ./hack/e2e.go ${E2E_OPT} -v -down
